page.title: 13FYFIELD RACING STABLES.
page.content: Fyfield House and grounds have been used for 23 years as stables for training race-horses. It is quiet yet central for travel. Toby Balding bought it soon after the death of his father and moved from Weyhill where his father, a famous polo player and captain of England from 1930 to 1957, had trained. Mr Balding told us that his stables could hold 65 horses, though during the Flat Season, with the jumpers resting, there were only 35. They are fed at 5.45am. and exercised daily for an hour and a half on the gallops at Kimpton. Among Mr Balding's 2000 winners was Highland Wedding, Grand National winner of 1969. Mr Balding spoke of the vast amount of money involved in modern racing, of the value in millions of the Derby winner and of yearling prices ranging from Â£1000 to Â£4000000.
